infos.value: Check the <color=#00ffff>attack type resistance</color> of the enemy in order to effectively deal damage.
Attack the enemy with the same <color=#00ffff>attack type</color> in <color=#00ffff>succession</color> to generate a <color=#00ffff>Chain</color>.
<color=#00ffff>Adjust the camera view</color> to locate enemies on the field. When first starting out, it's best to select <color=#00ffff>Unit</color> when <color=#00ffff>casting abilities</color>.
Try using <color=#00ffff>TP</color>-consuming abilities, <color=#00ffff>AP</color>-consuming abilities, and <color=#00ffff>Limit Bursts</color>.
Every unit in your party has <color=#00ffff>Affinity</color> for an <color=#00ffff>element</color>. Check <color=#00ffff>each unit's Affinity</color> before <color=#00ffff>attacking</color>.

<color=#00ffff>Abilities</color> have <color=#00ffff>elemental types</color>, while <color=#00ffff>units</color> have <color=#00ffff>elemental resistances</color>. Attack a target after checking its elemental resistance.

If multiple units use <color=#00ffff>abilities</color> of the <color=#00ffff>same element</color> on an enemy in <color=#00ffff>succession</color>, an <color=#00ffff>Elemental Chain</color> will be generated.

<color=#00ffff>Mach√©rie</color> can use <color=#00ffff>Esuna</color> to <color=#00ffff>remove</color> <color=#00ffff>status ailments</color> from afflicted units, while <color=#00ffff>Calamity Guard</color> can help <color=#00ffff>prevent</color> units from being inflicted by those <color=#00ffff>status ailments</color>.
Confirm an <color=#00ffff>enemy's status ailment resistance</color> and try inflicting a status ailment to which it has <color=#00ffff>low resistance</color>.
The <color=#00ffff>range of arrows increases</color> when they're shot from <color=#00ffff>high places</color>.

Units with high <color=#00ffff>AGI</color> can act more <color=#00ffff>quickly</color> than others, and <color=#00ffff>their next turn</color> will <color=#00ffff>come sooner</color> if they <color=#00ffff>limit the actions they take</color> during their turn.

When <color=#00ffff>a unit's HP reaches 0</color>, they will be <color=#00ffff>KO'd</color> and a countdown will appear over their head. At <color=#00ffff>count 0</color>, the KO'd unit will <color=#00ffff>withdraw</color> from the field.
<color=#00ffff>KO'd units</color> will <color=#00ffff>drop items</color>, while <color=#00ffff>withdrawn units</color> will leave behind <color=#00ffff>Crystals</color>.
Fill the <color=#00ffff>Evocation Gauge</color> to activate powerful <color=#00ffff>Evocation Magic</color>.
